column4: hi every bod, when i type this command in terminal " sudo gedit /etc/inittab "   it gives me blank page ... is it correct or i got some error?
inittab isn't used in ubuntu anymore
can you check this page please. ? http://www.zolved.com/synapse/view_content/28224/How_to_tune_your_Ubuntu_PC_for_faster_performance_
that's an old article, it doesn't count for the newer versions anymore
I haven't read all of it, but the inittab thing is definately outdated
seems only the first thing still works, but I'd be careful with messing with the sytem files
choose startup applications (or something like it) in the system menu
don't know, I've rarely ever needed to use swappiness
swappiness is a number that determines how quickly the swap partition is used
it can free more RAM from your hard drive, but it's slower
well, your apps have more memory available, but writing to the disk is slower than writing to RAM
by disabling some of the startup applications
there should be a short description about what it does
but I wouldn't disable anything you don't know what it does
disable bluetooth if you don't use it, etc
just re-enable them
just log off and log on
they aren't actually disabled until you do that, too
strange, what language are you using? most of my entries have descriptions
well, the entries have titles right? that should help you a bit
well, don't disable anything the title of which doesn't mean anything to you
sorry, can't really help you with that since I don't know what services are started at bootup
I really don't have the time to help you with something as big as that, but you could try a lightweight ubuntu version
